Hope to see some of you in there.

blog.name: cherie-fairy
blog.title: Unafraid Of Being Me
blog.description: I am Cherie Fairy and I am 26 years of age. I am in the world of alternative fashion. I live with anxiety and loneliness, but they don’t pay rent. I post things that are relevant to my personal interests; whether it’s music, animals, maybe someone else I like (from YouTube or wherever)...amongst whatever else I’m into. I’m not always interested in messaging. Unless I know you personally and are trusted, don’t message me. It’s been a while since I’ve done anything here, this is the “end of 2018 description update”. Hope you guys like what I have here.

summary:
I’m curious about something...
Am I the only one who’s completely lost any and all interest in the superhero movie genre? 
Like...
body:
I’m curious about something…

Am I the only one who’s completely lost any and all interest in the superhero movie genre?

Like I have zero interest in any new Marvel or DC movies right now. I used to be very on board to go see them, but now I’m kinda just…over it.

I think it’s because literally SO MANY of them come out at the same time and a lot of them come off as being very similar in formula. It’s too repetitive for me.

Now I’m not saying no one is allowed to enjoy them, everyone is allowed to enjoy whatever they want, this is just how I’m feeling. It’s just, to me, that the amount of superhero movies that come out in a short span of time is overwhelming. I’ve gotten too overwhelmed and honestly too bored to keep up with them. I can’t spend that much money at a theater every year for a movie that I’m probably not going to enjoy…or even to see a movie where I will have no idea what’s going on. Primarily cause I’ve skipped so many movies in between and I couldn’t have been bothered to see them. And been to broke to go to a theater that often. Oooooor like I was last year with a physical ailment that kept me from going anywhere.

My interest this year has been peaked by live action Pokémon and Godzilla, that’s all I’ll probably need this summer.

summary: My favorite thing about the Marvel fandom?
body:
My favorite thing about the Marvel fandom?

We all just made fandom Loki, a magical chaos deity, into the little shit who happens to be the living embodiment of the Lucky Luciano and Fiji Water Girl meme, only better because:

  1. He can shapeshift and cast illusions to be whatever he wants to be
  2. This is almost always interpreted as something meant to be affectionate, which says A Lot about how siblings interpret that, not all of it bad but definitely not all good either
  3. This little shit biscuit is actually funny because, like a true sibling, this is solely to fuck with, or help out, his big brother

summary:
conrad6136 
 replied to your post   “Tesseract Theory”
                        could also be she may have told Howard of the...
body:
conrad6136

replied to your post

“Tesseract Theory”

could also be she may have told Howard of the skrulls and that the tesseract could help save them. Perhaps Howard gave her the tesseract as he follows what Steve rogers would have done and help others.

YES. I think this is also incredibly likely. Howard was a bad parent but not a bad person, and if Mar-Vell could get Howard to believe her, he very well might have given her the Tesseract - he could have even come up with a logical reason for it, since Project Pegasus was already a joint SHIELD/Air Force project.
